critique: The executive order is a formal document that amends a section of the Civil Service Rules. The order itself is unemotional, but given the context of the emergency declared by the President on May 27, 1941, and the date of the order (November 17, 1941), it is likely related to World War II. The order likely aims to inspire a sense of preparedness and resolve, but not necessarily joy. It could also cause a bit of fear. Disgust, sadness, and surprise are not likely emotions the president wants to convey.
